comment: Thankyou MIT!
Your reaching is good. Can I get your notes please ?

Organic chemistry really is just 3 months worth of classes and labs...not a bad idea to take the course of it’s dealing with medicine. There’s a few prerequisites like general chemistry 1 and 2...and if you’re that excited about the field...do biochem and molecular cell bio.
Hey teacher! You're awesome dude,
Thanks for this great video. I have a question. At 38:47, why is the delta(H) of reaction not equal to the delta H of the products minus the reactants?

OCW 5.111 lectures are very good and everything is explained in details . Thanks a lot. Could you guys please upload the problem sets for 5.111 on the OCW webpage ? It would be very helpful and I don't want to go through a no. of books for problems. Thanks again

thank you for such a brilliant lecture. I have an issue with the structure of glucose as it is drawn in the example for calculating the reactant enthalpies. Is it justified to not use the cyclic version of it? (in particular  as the number of C-C vs C-H bonds is affected)
what about valence bond theory and hybridization in the transition elements ?
excellent, i love it!
Madam, I love your way of teaching chemistry so much! You make it so interesting. Keep on the good work!!
Wonderfull lecture...she makes the study so interesting...Lovely way of teaching..

They don't have covalent bonds
